paper_metadata.title: Social cash transfer (CT) programs and women's empowerment: Evidence from Tanzania

component_a_cash_support.cash_evidence_citation: CTs delivered through TASAF III are directed at households living in conditions of extreme poverty. TASAF III is a livelihood enhancement program, in which CTs are used to enable poor households (most of which are headed by women) to increase incomes and opportunities while improving consumption

study_characteristics.outcomes_evidence_citation: We adopt outcome variables following Evans et al. (2013), who analyzed individual characteristics such as economic activity, time allocation, consumption and assets, and savings and credit
study_characteristics.design_evidence_citation: Results from a quasi-experimental design show that TASAF targets poor households and does have an impact within its own sphere

bonus_information.qualitative_evidence_citation: Results from a quasi-experimental design show that TASAF targets poor households and does have an impact within its own sphere. These results are corroborated by qualitative data findings used in the study

evidence_citations.program_name_citation: In 2013, Tanzania introduced a national program of social CTs through the third phase of the Tanzania Social Action Fund (TASAF)
evidence_citations.country_citation: In 2013, Tanzania introduced a national program of social CTs through the third phase of the Tanzania Social Action Fund (TASAF)
evidence_citations.target_population_citation: CTs delivered through TASAF III are directed at households living in conditions of extreme poverty
